title: Azure DevOps CLI Authentication Setup
body:
To use Azure DevOps CLI (az devops) after Azure CLI authentication, follow these steps:

1. **Install Azure DevOps Extension**:
   ```powershell
   az extension add --name azure-devops
   ```

2. **Authenticate with Azure CLI**:
   ```powershell
   # Option 1: Default login (uses WAM on Windows)
   az login
   
   # Option 2: Force browser-based authentication
   az login --use-device-code
   
   # Option 3: Login to specific tenant
   az login --tenant TENANT_ID
   ```

3. **Configure Default Organization**:
   ```powershell
   az devops configure --defaults organization=https://dev.azure.com/YOUR_ORG
   ```

4. **Verify Authentication**:
   ```powershell
   az devops project list --output table
   ```

**Key Authentication Options**:
- `--use-device-code`: Forces browser-based authentication (recommended for MCP server compatibility)
- `--tenant TENANT_ID`: Authenticate against specific Azure AD tenant
- No PAT token required when using az login authentication

**Note**: Azure DevOps MCP servers may still require separate PAT token authentication via environment variables (AZDO_PAT, AZDO_ORG_URL) even when Azure CLI authentication works.
